duties_responsibilities.duty: Operates and monitors electric, electronic, mechanical, hydraulic, and pneumatic equipment at a hydroelectric plant.
Ensures worker safety when malfunctions occur and issues switching orders for plant equipment.
Receives instructions for power plant operations from dispatchers and inspects powerhouses, dams, switchyards, and equipment.
Maintains logs, prepares reports, and acts as the local plant 911 emergency dispatcher.
Trains Hydroelectric Operator I’s, inspects and operates high voltage switching stations, and participates in special projects.
Performs other related duties as assigned.

education_certification.credential: Two years’ experience in the electrical trade or as a Hydroelectric Operator (or a combination of education, and/or training and/or experience which provides an equivalent background required to perform the work of the class)
Normal sense of smell, hearing, and color vision
Required to be on call 24 hours/day to respond to emergency situations
Required to work nights, evenings, weekends, holidays and/or rotating shifts
Required to stand, walk or bend for extended periods of time and work at heights in confined areas

Required to lift objects weighing in excess of 50 pounds, handle or work with toxic/hazardous substances, operate and work around energized equipment, and work outdoors in remote locations and travel in all types of weather
Required to work in a noisy environment
